content:
Diagnosis
	1. Lingular adenocarcinoma of lung with liver metastases
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	None indicated

	Radiotherapy
	None

	Chemotherapy
	Carboplatin/Pemetrexed/Pembrolizumab - 3 cycles completed

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease in liver

	Current issues
	Fatigue, right upper quadrant pain, reduced appetite

	Summary of consultation
	This 56-year-old lady attended clinic today accompanied by her husband to discuss disease progression. Unfortunately, her most recent CT scan shows significant progression of liver metastases with the largest lesion increasing from 3.2cm to 5.1cm, and development of three new lesions. The primary lung lesion remains stable at 2.8cm.

She has experienced increasing right upper quadrant discomfort requiring escalation of analgesia, and her performance status has declined from ECOG 1 to ECOG 2 due to fatigue and liver pain. Her appetite has reduced significantly over the past three weeks.

Molecular results from her initial biopsy have now returned showing ROS1 fusion positive status (previously pending) and PD-L1 expression of 80%. Given this new information and evidence of disease progression, we have discussed transitioning to entrectinib therapy.

On examination today, there is tender hepatomegaly extending 4cm below the costal margin. Chest examination reveals reduced air entry at the left base but no added sounds.

	Further investigations
	Liver function tests, clotting screen, and ECG to be checked prior to entrectinib

	Medication prescribed
	Entrectinib 600mg once daily to start once baseline investigations complete

	Follow up
	Urgent review in 2 weeks to assess tolerability of new treatment
Telephone assessment by specialist nurse in 1 week

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor liver function tests weekly for first month of entrectinib
Please refer to district nurses for support with medication compliance

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows progression of liver metastases, largest lesion increased from 3.2cm to 5.1cm with three new lesions. Primary lung lesion stable at 2.8cm
Molecular testing confirms ROS1 fusion positive status and PD-L1 expression 80%
Discontinuing Carboplatin/Pemetrexed/Pembrolizumab due to disease progression

patient_facts.value: ECOG PS deteriorated from 1 to 2 due to fatigue and liver pain
Increasing right upper quadrant discomfort requiring escalation of analgesia
Reduced appetite over past three weeks
Tender hepatomegaly extending 4cm below costal margin
Reduced air entry at left base without added sounds

status_updates.value: Metastatic lung adenocarcinoma showing progression on first-line therapy. New molecular results enable switch to targeted therapy with entrectinib
Progressive disease with significant growth of liver metastases and new lesions
Changing to entrectinib 600mg daily based on ROS1 positive status
Deterioration in performance status from ECOG 1 to 2 due to fatigue and liver pain
Liver function tests, clotting screen, and ECG prior to starting entrectinib
Urgent review in 2 weeks with telephone assessment by specialist nurse in 1 week
